paragraphs.content: Chapter 22
paragraphs.contentHtml: Chapter 22

paragraphs.content: A good name is rather to be chosen than great riches, and loving favour rather than silver and gold.
paragraphs.contentHtml: A good name is rather to be chosen than great riches, and loving favour rather than silver and gold.

paragraphs.content: The rich and poor meet together: the LORD is the maker of them all.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The rich and poor meet together: the Lord is the maker of them all.

paragraphs.content: A prudent man foreseeth the evil, and hideth himself: but the simple pass on, and are punished.
paragraphs.contentHtml: A prudent man foreseeth the evil, and hideth himself: but the simple pass on, and are punished.

paragraphs.content: By humility and the fear of the LORD are riches, and honour, and life.
paragraphs.contentHtml: By humility and the fear of the Lord are riches, and honour, and life.

paragraphs.content: Thorns and snares are in the way of the froward: he that doth keep his soul shall be far from them.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Thorns and snares are in the way of the froward: he that doth keep his soul shall be far from them.

paragraphs.content: Train up a child in the way he should go: and when he is old, he will not depart from it.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Train up a child in the way he should go: and when he is old, he will not depart from it.

paragraphs.content: The rich ruleth over the poor, and the borrower is servant to the lender.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The rich ruleth over the poor, and the borrower is servant to the lender.

paragraphs.content: He that soweth iniquity shall reap vanity: and the rod of his anger shall fail.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He that soweth iniquity shall reap vanity: and the rod of his anger shall fail.

paragraphs.content: He that hath a bountiful eye shall be blessed; for he giveth of his bread to the poor.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He that hath a bountiful eye shall be blessed; for he giveth of his bread to the poor.

paragraphs.content: Cast out the scorner, and contention shall go out; yea, strife and reproach shall cease.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Cast out the scorner, and contention shall go out; yea, strife and reproach shall cease.

paragraphs.content: He that loveth pureness of heart, for the grace of his lips the king shall be his friend.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He that loveth pureness of heart, for the grace of his lips the king shall be his friend.

paragraphs.content: The eyes of the LORD preserve knowledge, and he overthroweth the words of the transgressor.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The eyes of the Lord preserve knowledge, and he overthroweth the words of the transgressor.

paragraphs.content: The slothful man saith, There is a lion without, I shall be slain in the streets.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The slothful man saith, There is a lion without, I shall be slain in the streets.

paragraphs.content: The mouth of strange women is a deep pit: he that is abhorred of the LORD shall fall therein.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The mouth of strange women is a deep pit: he that is abhorred of the Lord shall fall therein.

paragraphs.content: Foolishness is bound in the heart of a child; but the rod of correction shall drive it far from him.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Foolishness is bound in the heart of a child; but the rod of correction shall drive it far from him.

paragraphs.content: He that oppresseth the poor to increase his riches, and he that giveth to the rich, shall surely come to want.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He that oppresseth the poor to increase his riches, and he that giveth to the rich, shall surely come to want.

paragraphs.content: Bow down thine ear, and hear the words of the wise, and apply thine heart unto my knowledge.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Bow down thine ear, and hear the words of the wise, and apply thine heart unto my knowledge.

paragraphs.content: For it is a pleasant thing if thou keep them within thee; they shall withal be fitted in thy lips.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For it is a pleasant thing if thou keep them within thee; they shall withal be fitted in thy lips.

paragraphs.content: That thy trust may be in the LORD, I have made known to thee this day, even to thee.
paragraphs.contentHtml: That thy trust may be in the Lord, I have made known to thee this day, even to thee.

paragraphs.content: Have not I written to thee excellent things in counsels and knowledge,
paragraphs.contentHtml: Have not I written to thee excellent things in counsels and knowledge,

paragraphs.content: That I might make thee know the certainty of the words of truth; that thou mightest answer the words of truth to them that send unto thee?
paragraphs.contentHtml: That I might make thee know the certainty of the words of truth; that thou mightest answer the words of truth to them that send unto thee?

paragraphs.content: Rob not the poor, because he is poor: neither oppress the afflicted in the gate:
paragraphs.contentHtml: Rob not the poor, because he is poor: neither oppress the afflicted in the gate:

paragraphs.content: For the LORD will plead their cause, and spoil the soul of those that spoiled them.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For the Lord will plead their cause, and spoil the soul of those that spoiled them.

paragraphs.content: Make no friendship with an angry man; and with a furious man thou shalt not go:
paragraphs.contentHtml: Make no friendship with an angry man; and with a furious man thou shalt not go:

paragraphs.content: Lest thou learn his ways, and get a snare to thy soul.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Lest thou learn his ways, and get a snare to thy soul.

paragraphs.content: Be not thou one of them that strike hands, or of them that are sureties for debts.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Be not thou one of them that strike hands, or of them that are sureties for debts.

paragraphs.content: If thou hast nothing to pay, why should he take away thy bed from under thee?
paragraphs.contentHtml: If thou hast nothing to pay, why should he take away thy bed from under thee?

paragraphs.content: Remove not the ancient landmark, which thy fathers have set.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Remove not the ancient landmark, which thy fathers have set.

paragraphs.content: Seest thou a man diligent in his business? he shall stand before kings; he shall not stand before mean men.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Seest thou a man diligent in his business? he shall stand before kings; he shall not stand before mean men.
